About Me

Let me tell you a few things..

BIO

Software Engineer with 5 years of experience designing user-centric, accessible applications for businesses in education, health, and finance. Specialises in developing UI/UX solutions that drive engagement and operational efficiency, aiming to create impactful, inclusive products that solve real-world problems and serve social causes.

SKILLS

Programming Languages & Web Technologies: JavaScript, TypeScript, Python. ReactJS, Node, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, ReactNative, Flask, Django, Ruby, Ruby on Rails
DevOps Tools & CI/CD: Docker, Kubernetes, Redis, Git, GitHub, CircleCI, TravisCI, Test Driven Development
APIs & Tools: RESTful APIs, GraphQL, Postman, Swagger
Database Systems: SQL, PostgreSQL, NoSQL, MongoDB
Soft Skills: Leadership, Agile Project Management, Remote Team Collaboration, Cross-Cultural Communication

MICROVERSE

Code Reviewer (06/21 - Present)

Microverse is a global school for imparting web development and career-ready skills to a diversified group across the globe.

Location: San Francisco, USA (Remote)

Key results and accomplishments;

  • Scheduled 15+ 1 on 1 video calls with remote developers and successfully guided and unblocked them.
  • Review Pull Requests paying attention to detail and offering ASK(Actionable, Specific and Kind) feedback to help guide the writing of world-class code features.
  • Mentor junior web developers, providing technical support through performing code reviews while using mindful communication to empathise and make the code reviews motivational, engaging and memorable so as to add value to encourage the coders to learn more from the reviews and act on the changes.
  • Propose improvements to code organization to improve code quality and overall performance by seeking clarity with questions asked about particular code components and being clear, giving examples and explaining the rationale behind the proposed changes.

HIVE COLAB

Learning Facilitator (11/19 - 02/20)

Hive Colab is an innovation hub, community owned, collaborative, co-working space for the Uganda's Technology community.

Location: Kampala, Uganda (On site)

Key results and accomplishments;

  • Facilitated training of 20+ women at tech boot camps designed with a project-based approach to improve their problem-solving skills.
  • Researched and implemented modern teaching techniques that improved learner satisfaction by making it easier to grasp abstract concepts.
  • Created and demonstrated 2 IoT projects to help guide learners in building their own
  • Events organization and execution of 3 successful bootcamps and hackathons for the learners in entrepreneurship and Internet Of Things.
